derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hēawan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch houwen and German hauen

entry.def: If you hew stone or wood, you cut it, for example with an axe.

example.ex: He felled, peeled and hewed his own timber.
example.tran: 他自己砍树、剥皮、劈成木材。

entry.def: If something is hewn from stone or wood, it is cut from stone or wood.

example.ex: ...the rock from which the lower chambers and subterranean passageways have been hewn.
example.tran: 开凿出下闸室和地下通道的岩石

example.ex: ...medieval monasteries hewn out of the rockface.
example.tran: 在岩壁上凿出的中世纪修道院

means.word_mean: 1. make or shape as with an axe;

sentences.sentence: "hew out a path in the rock"

means.word_mean: 2. strike with an axe; cut down, strike;

sentences.en: He hewed a canoe out of a tree trunk.

sentences.en: The hunters hewed a path through the jungle.
